public class AuthenticationUtil
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Utility class for authenticating, controlling and managing user-accounts.

2.4.2
Author:
Kim (http://code.google.com/p/vaadin-appfoundation), Matthias Gianfelice

Method Detail

authenticate

public static User authenticate(java.lang.Long id,
                                java.lang.String password)
                         throws InvalidLoginDataException,
                                TooManyFailedLoginsException
Try to log in a user with the given user credentials.

Parameters:
id - the id
password - the password
Returns:
The object of the new, inlogged user
Throws:
InvalidLoginDataException - The given data is wrong or invalid
TooManyFailedLoginsException - When the password was wrong too many times, this exception will be thrown

getHash

protected static java.lang.String getHash(java.lang.String text)
Generates a hash out of an password-string.

Parameters:
text - the text
Returns:
The hash, created out of the given text

getUser

public static User getUser(java.lang.Long id)
Gets a user by it's ID.

Parameters:
id - the id
Returns:
The user with the given ID

getUserByEmail

public static User getUserByEmail(java.lang.String email)
Gets a user by it's email.

Parameters:
email - the email
Returns:
The user with the given email.

createFirstUser

public static boolean createFirstUser(java.lang.String firstName,
                                      java.lang.String lastName,
                                      java.lang.String email,
                                      java.lang.String password)
Creates the first user of the system. If already a user is registered, the action will be aborted.

Parameters:
firstName - the first name
lastName - the last name
email - the email
password - the password
Returns:
If there's another user registered, this method will return false and abort the operation, if the user was created, it'll return true

createUser

public static User createUser(java.lang.String firstName,
                              java.lang.String lastName,
                              java.lang.String email,
                              java.lang.String password)
Adds a user to the application.

Parameters:
firstName - the first name
lastName - the last name
email - the email
password - the password
Returns:
The newly created user

isCurrentUserAdmin

public static boolean isCurrentUserAdmin()
Checks, whether the current inlogged user is an administrator.

Returns:
True, if the current inlogged user is an administrator, otherwise false

isEmailAvailable

public static boolean isEmailAvailable(java.lang.String email)
Checks, whether the given email is already in use.

Parameters:
email - the email
Returns:
Whether the email is available
